## **Professional Experience**

2018 – 2020
GIS PROGRAM LEAD, CASCADE WATER ALLIANCE
•	Leading the development, implementation, and management of Cascade's GIS program
•	Leading the development of Cascade’s water conservation outreach programs 
•	Conducted analysis of water reservoirs to model water storage relationships using remotely sensed LiDAR data and ArcGIS Pro
•	Developing sophisticated GIS applications to assist in field operations, invasive species treatment, communications, document management, and asset management
•	Communicating regularly with member organizations, consultants, neighboring water districts, water conservation partners via email, phone, meetings, etc.
•	Presented my work to over 30 WA elected officials and water district representatives
•	Led introductory GIS training for staff members

2018 – 2019 (SEASONAL)
FIELD TECHNICIAN, WDFW & HUXLEY COLLEGE
•	Co-led the recovery of radio collars in the North Cascades following mountain goat mortalities (Olympic National Park Mountain Goat Relocation Project)
•	Utilized radio telemetry equipment to monitor mountain goat movement 
•	Navigated through back country using radio telemetry, GPS, compass, maps, etc.
•	Endured multi-night back country missions through harsh conditions such as heavy rains, snow, cold temperatures, etc.
•	Presented written and verbal field reports encompassing observational and natural history skills as well as plant, animal, and track identification

2014 – 2017
OUTDOOR RECREATIONAL GUIDE, COMPASS OUTDOOR ADVENTURES
•	Led client groups in week long and overnight outdoor adventures
•	Mentored clients in confidence building outdoor activities including mountain biking, backpacking, rafting, snowshoeing, and rock climbing
•	Collaborated with co-workers in managing inherent risk while successfully providing positive experiences
•	Communicated directly with clients through face-to-face and electronic communication
•	Managed multiple personalities and experience levels of individuals
